articles.content: Afghan Morteza Mohammadi (center-left) and his companions sit around a fire in the former Krajina Metal factory in Bihac, Bosnia-Herzegovina, near the Croatian border, discussing possible border cros… [+15783 chars]
articles.description: Bosnia-Herzegovina has become the main hub for migrants trying to reach wealthier European nations, a journey they call the "game." Among the risks: being beaten up and sent back by border police.
articles.title: For Migrants In Bosnia, The 'Game' Is A Perilous Journey To A Better Life - NPR
